text: Was here for a birthday lunch with 6 friends. Best service from the staffs here especially Josh. Food and drinks were served in a fast and orderly manner. We tried almost everything on the menu from starters, main and desserts. Definitely recommending this place to others as we will be coming back again.

For a taste of classic Western dishes with a unique local flair, Tanglin Cookhouse delivers both in flavor and value. The Hainanese Pork Chop was recommended by a young a gentleman, Godwin as we were overwhelmed by the choices available. It was amazing and live up to its chef recommendation. Despite the large afternoon crowd, service was amazing. Kudos to Godwin and the team for making our lunch enjoyable. Will visit again in the near future to try other dishes!

Food is just average. The Grandma's chicken is really dry.
Dessert (sticky date pudding) is really sweet.
The pork kurobuta is good üëç and so are the Yorkshire puddings üçÆ.

Came here for Christmas dinner and it was a great experience. They had a $48 3-course meal which has a salad, turkey roulade and tiramisu! Amazing.

I really enjoyed the fish n chips and the beef steak as well. The fries and coleslaw was amazing and generous!

Amazing find.

Ordered a set lunch here on a weekday.
Hainanese pork chop, with a mushroom soup. Changed the sides to salad instead of fries and glad that they allowed this .
Pork chop was flavourful.
Mushroom soup was a tad salty for my liking.

We shared a Dessert, the ondeh cake. Everyone liked it.  The coffee was a strong brew which I really enjoyed. Overall a great meal indeed.

Highlight of the meal was the impeccable  service. Server Gabby was constantly making sure all was good. She even asked if she should serve the coffee during lunch or after the meal.
